title: Rangpur Riders vs Bowler Hunters – Clash of Titans in the 2025 Global Super League
description:
The 2025 Global Super League (GSL) is set to witness a thrilling encounter as the defending champions, Rangpur Riders, face off against the formidable Bowler Hunters. This match promises high-octane action, strategic brilliance, and a showcase of cricketing prowess at its finest.


Background:

The Rangpur Riders, a prominent franchise in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL), have consistently demonstrated excellence on the field. Their victory in the inaugural GSL in 2024, where they defeated Cricket Victoria by 56 runs in the final, solidified their reputation as a powerhouse in T20 cricket. Key players like Soumya Sarkar, who was named Player of the Series, and captain Nurul Hasan have been instrumental in their success. Sportsmax+2News Room Guyana+2Stabroek News+2BDNews24+7Wikipedia+7Cricket World+7Stabroek News+6Sportsmax+6News Room Guyana+6

The Bowler Hunters, known for their aggressive bowling attack and tactical acumen, have been making waves in the T20 circuit. Their disciplined approach and ability to adapt to different match situations make them a formidable opponent.

Team Line-ups:

Rangpur Riders:

  • Captain: Nurul Hasan

  • Key Players: Soumya Sarkar, Steven Taylor, Mahedi Hasan, Harmeet Singh

  • Coach: Mickey Arthur The Financial Express+7Global Super League T20+7Wikipedia+7United News Bangladesh+3Cricket.com+3Wikipedia+3

Bowler Hunters:

  • Captain: [Captain's Name]

  • Key Players: [Player Names]

  • Coach: [Coach's Name]WikipediaCricket World+1Global Super League T20+1

Match Venue:

The match will be held at the Providence Stadium in Georgetown, Guyana. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and enthusiastic crowd, the stadium provides the perfect setting for this high-stakes encounter.

Key Battles to Watch:

  • Soumya Sarkar vs. Bowler Hunters' Pace Attack: Sarkar's aggressive batting style will be tested against the Hunters' formidable pace bowlers.

  • Spin Duel: The effectiveness of Rangpur's spinners, like Harmeet Singh, against the Hunters' middle order could be a deciding factor.

What’s at Stake:

For the Rangpur Riders, a victory would reinforce their dominance in the GSL and boost their confidence for the rest of the tournament. For the Bowler Hunters, defeating the reigning champions would be a significant statement and could propel them to the top of the standings.Global Super League T20+3Stabroek News+3Sportsmax+3

Conclusion:

This match between the Rangpur Riders and the Bowler Hunters is more than just a game; it's a battle of strategies, skills, and nerves. Cricket enthusiasts can expect a captivating contest filled with thrilling moments and exceptional performances.

Note: Specific details about the Bowler Hunters' team composition and player statistics are currently unavailable. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, please refer to the official Global Super League website or the respective teams' official channels.

title: University of Scholars Celebrates Its 1st Convocation Ceremony
description:
On February 22, 2025, the University of Scholars marked a significant milestone by hosting its inaugural convocation ceremony at Senanprangon, Dhaka Cantonment. This historic event celebrated the academic achievements of its first graduating cohort, symbolizing the university's commitment to excellence in higher education.TBS News+4LinkedIn+4Facebook+4

Established in 2015, the University of Scholars has rapidly evolved into a reputable institution, offering diverse programs across various faculties. The convocation ceremony was a testament to the university's dedication to nurturing professionals equipped to meet global challenges.

The event featured addresses from esteemed faculty members and dignitaries, who commended the graduates for their perseverance and encouraged them to contribute meaningfully to society. The ceremony also included the conferral of degrees and special recognitions for outstanding academic performances.Uttara University

Graduates, adorned in traditional academic regalia, were joined by proud family members, friends, and faculty, creating an atmosphere of joy and accomplishment. The university's motto, "We Build Professionals," resonated throughout the event, reflecting its mission to produce skilled and ethical leaders.University of Scholars+1Wikipedia+1

The successful execution of the first convocation sets a precedent for future ceremonies, reinforcing the University of Scholars' role in shaping the educational landscape of Bangladesh.

title: University of Scholars Inter Department Cricket Battle 2025
description:
The University of Scholars hosted its much-anticipated Inter Department Cricket Battle 2025 from January 2 to January 11, 2025, at the Banani Shaheed Zayan Choudhury Playground in Dhaka. This vibrant tournament brought together ten departmental teams, competing fiercely across 24 matches in a 10-over format.CricHeroes

  • EEE Sparks demonstrated remarkable skill throughout the tournament, securing their place as the runners-up.

title: ThinkSpire 12 Session 2 – Empowering Future Leaders at the University of Scholars
description:
On January 10, 2025, the University of Scholars hosted the second session of its flagship mentorship and leadership development series, ThinkSpire 12. This session, held at the university's Banani campus, was designed to inspire and equip students with the skills and mindset necessary for leadership in the modern world.

Event Highlights:

  • Keynote Address: The session featured a powerful keynote address by the esteemed Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees, who shared insights on leadership, innovation, and the importance of a growth mindset.Facebook+3Facebook+3Instagram+3

  • Interactive Workshops: Students participated in interactive workshops focusing on critical thinking, problem-solving, and effective communication, facilitated by experienced mentors and industry professionals.

  • Networking Opportunities: Attendees had the chance to network with alumni and professionals, fostering connections that could support their academic and career aspirations.

Impact:

The session was met with enthusiasm and positive feedback from participants, who appreciated the opportunity to engage with thought leaders and develop skills that are essential for success in today's dynamic environment.

title: Winter Pitha and Puli Festival
description:
The Winter Pitha and Puli Festival is a cherished annual celebration in Bangladesh, held during the winter months, particularly around the Bengali months of Poush and Magh. This festival celebrates the rich culinary heritage of Bengali sweets, known as 'pitha' and 'puli', which are traditionally made from rice flour, jaggery, coconut, and other local ingredients.

During this time, families and communities come together to prepare and enjoy a variety of pithas and pulis, each with its unique taste and preparation method. Some popular varieties include:Wikipedia+1Wikipedia+1

  • Vapa Pitha: Steamed rice cakes filled with jaggery and coconut.Wikipedia

  • Chitai Pitha: Thin crepes made from rice flour, often served with sweet syrup.Wikipedia

  • Patisapta: Crepes filled with a mixture of khoya (reduced milk) and coconut, then rolled and served with syrup.

  • Nakshi Pitha: Decorative rice flour cakes adorned with intricate designs, symbolizing Bengali folk art.

The festival is not only about food but also about community bonding. In rural areas, it's common for neighbors to exchange pithas and pulis, strengthening social ties. In urban settings, pitha festivals are organized in various venues, attracting people from all walks of life to partake in this sweet tradition.

title: CSE Intra Department Cricket Tournament 2024 – Fostering Team Spirit and Sportsmanship
description:
On December 3, 2024, the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) at the University of Scholars hosted its annual Intra Department Cricket Tournament. This event aimed to promote camaraderie, teamwork, and a healthy competitive spirit among CSE students.

The tournament featured multiple teams comprising students from various academic years and sections within the CSE department. Matches were played in a knockout format, ensuring high stakes and thrilling encounters from the outset.

The final match was a highlight of the event, drawing enthusiastic support from fellow students, faculty members, and staff. The atmosphere was electric as the two finalist teams showcased their skills and determination on the field.

Beyond the competition, the tournament served as a platform for students to unwind from academic pressures, engage in physical activity, and build stronger relationships with peers and faculty. Such events are integral to the holistic development of students, aligning with the university's commitment to nurturing well-rounded professionals.

For more information about the tournament and other events at the University of Scholars, please visit the official event page.

title: Design Exhibition Presented by the Textile Department
description:
On November 28, 2023, the University of Scholars' Textile Engineering Department proudly hosted a Fashion Design Exhibition, marking the culmination of its intensive 3-month short course on Fashion Design. This event showcased the innovative creations of six student teams, each presenting unique and captivating designs that reflected their learning and creativity throughout the course.ius.edu.bd+1ius.edu.bd+1

The exhibition was graced by esteemed guests, including Md. Ariful Hoque Shuhan, Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees; Md. Mamunur Rashid, Acting Vice-Chancellor; Mr. Faisal Bin Alam, Head of the Textile Engineering Department and Associate Professor; Mr. Abdul Hasib Siddique, Chief Commercial Officer and BOT member; and Mr. Capt. (Retd.) Mobashwer A Khandaker, Registrar. Their presence underscored the university's commitment to fostering talent and innovation in the field of fashion design.ius.edu.bd

Expressing his admiration for the students' work, Md. Ariful Hoque Shuhan stated, "These young designers have demonstrated exceptional talent and innovation. I am confident that they have the full potential to make significant contributions to the fashion industry." He also announced plans to organize an inter-university fashion design competition to further showcase and nurture emerging talents.ius.edu.bd

This exhibition not only highlighted the students' creativity and craftsmanship but also reaffirmed the University of Scholars' dedication to its motto, "We Build Professionals." By providing practical platforms like this exhibition, the university continues to empower students to translate their academic knowledge into real-world applications, preparing them to become future leaders in the fashion industry.

title: A New Chapter Begins: Celebrating the Convocation of CSE Graduates at University of Scholars
description:
The air was filled with excitement, pride, and bittersweet emotions as the students of the Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) Department at the University of Scholars gathered for one of the most significant days of their academic lives — their convocation ceremony. Years of hard work, sleepless nights, group projects, coding marathons, lab exams, and vibrant campus memories culminated in this one glorious moment. It was a day not only to celebrate academic achievements but also to look forward with hope, courage, and determination to the future that lies ahead.

The grand convocation ceremony was held at the university auditorium, elegantly decorated with the university's signature colors, banners, and floral arrangements. Proud parents, respected faculty members, invited guests, and university authorities were in attendance to honor and witness the formal graduation of hundreds of bright young minds ready to embark on their professional journeys.

As the CSE graduates entered the venue in their academic regalia — black gowns with vibrant-colored hoods representing their faculty — there was a shared sense of pride that lit up the room. Friends embraced each other, families smiled with joy, and cameras clicked rapidly to capture memories that would be cherished for a lifetime. The ceremony was not just a formal event but a powerful celebration of resilience, growth, and transformation.

Opening of the Ceremony

The event commenced with the recitation from the Holy Quran, followed by a welcome speech from the Registrar of the University. The Vice-Chancellor then delivered the opening address, in which he emphasized the importance of education, ethics, and innovation in shaping the leaders of tomorrow. He reminded students that while this marks the end of their academic journey at the University of Scholars, it is also the beginning of a new adventure filled with opportunities and responsibilities.

"The world needs problem solvers, innovators, and ethical leaders — and I am confident that our CSE graduates are ready to take on that challenge," he stated.

Faculty Reflections

Professors and mentors from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering took the stage to share emotional reflections. They recounted the journey of this batch — how they overcame the sudden shift to online education during the pandemic, managed academic workloads, and collaborated on groundbreaking final-year projects. They praised the students’ creativity, discipline, and eagerness to push boundaries.

Dr. Nafisa Karim, Head of the CSE Department, said, “This convocation is a testimony to your strength and dedication. We have seen you grow — from confused first-year students into confident engineers who can now contribute meaningfully to society. Be proud, but remain humble. Always keep learning.”

Student Speeches

One of the highlights of the convocation was the valedictory speech delivered by the top-performing student from the department. With a voice trembling with emotion, the student thanked the faculty for their guidance, parents for their unwavering support, and friends for the unforgettable experiences shared over the years. She also encouraged her peers to remain passionate and never fear failure.

“We wrote our first line of code in this department. We built our first applications here. Some of us even failed a few times. But we got back up. Because that’s what this place taught us — to be brave. Let us carry that spirit wherever we go.”

Award Distribution and Degree Conferment

As the names of the graduates were called, each student walked across the stage to receive their certificate. The applause from the audience never waned — every single graduate was cheered for, regardless of their academic rank. The university also awarded medals and certificates of excellence to those who had shown outstanding academic or extracurricular achievements.

There were loud cheers as students from various CSE batches hugged, posed for group photos, and shared stories of their campus lives — from coding in the lab until midnight to preparing for job interviews, and organizing tech fests, seminars, and hackathons.

Some students wore badges with motivational phrases like “Code. Debug. Graduate. Repeat.” while others carried placards reading “Mission Accomplished” and “Hello World — I’m a Graduate Now!”

Family and Friends: The Silent Pillars

It was a day of emotional moments, especially for the parents and guardians who had supported their children’s educational journeys from the very beginning. Many were seen holding back tears as they watched their children receive their degrees, a tangible reward for years of perseverance.

“I saw her stay up nights learning Java, I saw her cry when her project crashed the night before submission, and today I saw her graduate. I cannot explain the pride I feel,” said the mother of a graduating student.

Some families traveled from distant regions to be present at the ceremony, showing the deep-rooted cultural and emotional importance of academic milestones in our society.

Looking Back: A Journey Worth Remembering

The University of Scholars CSE Department has always been known for its academic rigor and forward-thinking curriculum. This batch, in particular, has been part of significant changes in the department — from the adoption of online labs during COVID-19 to the introduction of AI and machine learning modules, from participating in international programming contests to developing real-world software solutions.

For many students, the journey included internships in reputed companies, contributing to open-source projects, and publishing research papers. The convocation was not just a celebration of their academic results but a recognition of their entire journey of growth and contribution to technology and innovation.

One graduate remarked, “This place taught me more than just programming. It taught me how to think critically, how to collaborate, how to solve problems — and how to never give up.”

Future Ahead: Dreams Beyond the Degree

As the confetti settled and the graduation caps flew high in the air, it became clear that the future is limitless for these CSE graduates. Some have already secured jobs in top tech companies in Bangladesh and abroad, some are planning to pursue higher education or research, while others are preparing to launch their own startups.

The university’s career development center was also praised for helping many of these graduates with job placements, resume building, and interview training. The spirit of entrepreneurship was evident in the stories of several students who had already started working on innovative tech solutions to local problems.

The message of the convocation was clear — the world is evolving at an incredible pace, and these graduates are not just ready to face it; they are ready to lead it.

A Moment Etched in Memory

The ceremony concluded with the national anthem, followed by a grand photo session with all graduates, faculty, and staff. The University of Scholars gifted each graduate a customized yearbook, a memento, and a message of hope from the Vice-Chancellor.

While some tears were shed and heartfelt goodbyes exchanged, one thing was certain: this convocation would remain one of the most defining moments in the lives of the graduates. It was not just about receiving a degree — it was about celebrating a community, a shared journey, and a future full of promise.

As the sun set on the university campus, the laughter and chatter of newly graduated engineers echoed through the halls one last time — but their legacy will remain, etched into the walls of the University of Scholars, and in the hearts of everyone who shared in this unforgettable day.

title: Honoring Success: CSE Graduates of University of Scholars Receive Certificates from Vice Chancellor Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher
description:
The grand auditorium of the University of Scholars was a vibrant mosaic of joy, achievement, and pride as the much-awaited convocation ceremony commenced for the graduating students of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE). The most iconic moment of the ceremony — and the most treasured memory for every student — was when each graduate ascended the stage to receive their graduation certificate directly from the esteemed Vice Chancellor, Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher.

It was more than just a formal exchange of a certificate — it was a moment that symbolized years of persistence, personal growth, and academic achievement. For the students, it marked the end of an incredible journey and the beginning of a promising future.

The Stage Set for a Historic Day

From the early morning hours, the University campus buzzed with excitement. Students arrived in their gowns and caps, cameras flashed everywhere, and laughter filled the air. For many students and their families, this was the most anticipated day in their academic lives.

The event took place in the university’s main auditorium, which had been beautifully decorated for the occasion. Flags bearing the university emblem, floral arrangements, banners highlighting the accomplishments of the graduating class, and an elegant stage setup provided the perfect backdrop for such a prestigious ceremony.

At the heart of the stage stood Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher, the Vice Chancellor of the University of Scholars, a respected academic leader known for his vision, integrity, and contribution to higher education in Bangladesh. His presence made the event even more meaningful for the students, who looked up to him not just as an administrator but as a guiding force behind their success.

A Ceremony of Dignity and Emotion

The convocation began with the national anthem, followed by an opening address by senior university officials. As the ceremony proceeded, all eyes turned to the main highlight — the distribution of certificates.

One by one, students from the CSE department were called to the stage. As each name echoed through the hall, loud cheers erupted from their friends and families. The graduates, dressed in academic regalia, proudly walked up to receive their certificates from Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher.

With a warm handshake and a few encouraging words, the Vice Chancellor handed over each certificate with a smile. For many, it was the first time meeting him personally. The moment was brief, yet powerful — a lifetime of effort acknowledged in a simple exchange of paper and mutual respect.

Some students bowed in gratitude, others gave a salute or a quick handshake. A few could not hold back their tears. For the faculty watching from the front rows, this was the moment their mentorship bore fruit. For parents watching from the gallery, it was a dream fulfilled.

The Significance of Receiving the Certificate from the Vice Chancellor

What made this ceremony especially memorable was that each graduate received their certificate directly from Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher — a rare honor. In many institutions, such duties are often delegated to deans or department heads due to time constraints. However, the Vice Chancellor of the University of Scholars made it a point to personally hand over each certificate.

This gesture reflected his deep commitment to student success. It wasn't just a ceremonial duty for him — it was an expression of pride in his students' accomplishments and the university's role in shaping future leaders. His presence elevated the entire experience, showing students that their hard work had been recognized at the highest level.

One student later said, “When the Vice Chancellor handed me the certificate and said, ‘Well done,’ it felt like all those sleepless nights, projects, and stress were worth it. It was the proudest moment of my life.”

Capturing Memories Through the Lens

Professional photographers were present to capture every handshake and every smile. The stage became the scene of countless emotional and unforgettable moments — graduates receiving their certificates, parents clicking pictures, professors hugging their students, and friends high-fiving each other with glee.

Many students posed with their certificates alongside Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher, who graciously smiled in every photo, knowing these images would become cherished memories for generations. Later, outside the auditorium, the university arranged for group photos, food stalls, and a memory wall where students could write farewell messages.

Voices of Gratitude and Aspiration

Throughout the ceremony, the overwhelming emotion was one of gratitude. Graduates were quick to thank their teachers, mentors, families, and the university administration for supporting them through their academic journey.

In her valedictory speech, a top-ranking CSE graduate said, “Receiving my certificate from Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher is a moment I will never forget. He has been an inspiration to all of us. This convocation is not just about academic success; it’s about the values we’ve learned here — discipline, respect, and vision.”

Students recalled their time in the university — from their very first class in programming fundamentals to their final year projects in AI, web development, cybersecurity, and data science. They spoke of how the CSE department, under the guidance of passionate faculty members, had prepared them not just as engineers but as responsible professionals and innovators.

A Leader Who Inspires: Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher

Much of the event's emotional weight was carried by the presence and words of Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher, whose keynote speech was both motivational and thought-provoking. He encouraged students to embrace the future with courage, curiosity, and compassion.

“In today’s world, technology is not just a tool — it is a way of solving human problems,” he said. “As engineers, your duty is not just to write code or build systems, but to contribute to society, to make life easier, better, and more secure for people.”

He urged graduates to continue learning, to never fear failure, and to stay grounded in values and ethics. His speech was met with a standing ovation, and many students were seen nodding with admiration.

Dr. Basher also acknowledged the challenges the students had faced during their studies — including the global pandemic, online classes, and shifting job markets — and praised their resilience and adaptability.

A Legacy of Excellence

This graduating batch of the CSE Department had set a new benchmark in terms of academic achievement, research output, and innovation. Many students had already secured placements in top software firms, tech startups, and government IT sectors. Others were preparing to pursue higher studies in prestigious universities in Bangladesh and abroad.

The Vice Chancellor proudly announced that this year’s graduating class included:

  • Multiple students who published international research papers.

  • National-level hackathon winners.

  • Contributors to open-source projects.

  • Final-year projects adopted by local industries for real-world application.

The ceremony was not just about the conferral of degrees but about acknowledging a generation that is ready to lead Bangladesh’s digital transformation.

The Final Bow

As the event drew to a close, emotions ran high. Students exchanged hugs, snapped final selfies, and wrote farewell notes on each other's gowns. The official ceremony ended with the national anthem and a final address from the university management.

But the real takeaway was the bond that had been forged — between students and teachers, between knowledge and ambition, and between dreams and reality. The image of each student receiving their certificate from Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher would forever remain etched in their memory.

Outside the hall, laughter and cheer continued late into the afternoon as groups of graduates wandered through the campus one last time — stopping by their favorite classrooms, computer labs, cafeteria corners, and library halls. These were more than buildings; they were witnesses to their transformation.

A New Journey Begins

With their certificates in hand and dreams in their hearts, the graduates of the University of Scholars now stand at the edge of a new beginning. Whether they go on to become software engineers, data scientists, researchers, or entrepreneurs, one thing is certain — they will carry with them the values and spirit instilled in them by their alma mater.

And in that defining moment — captured in hundreds of photographs — where each of them received their certificate from Prof. Dr. Enamul Basher, the Vice Chancellor who believed in them — they stepped confidently into the future.

The University of Scholars salutes the graduating batch of CSE students. May their journey ahead be bright, impactful, and filled with purpose.

title: University of Scholars presents: 3rd Intra University Programming Contest
description:
+

3rd Intra University Programming Contest                                           The University of Scholars presents to you the 3rd Intra University Programming Contest hosted by the Computer Science and Engineering department in association with The University of Scholars Problem-Solving Community of the CSE department, event partner - Envyweb Studio.


A total of 28 teams, each consisting of 3 members, took part in this challenging contest where all of them were students of different batches from the Computer Science and Engineering department of the University itself.


An esteemed judges panel was present to overlook the contest and give their final verdict. After that, there was a small prize-giving ceremony held to encourage and celebrate the victory of the participants. The Vice Chairman and Member, of the Board of Trustees of the University of Scholars, Mr. Ariful Hoque Shuhan, was specially present to hand over these prizes. in the end, two teams tied up for the 2nd Runners Up positions, and an attractive prize was given to the best all-girls team for their effort too.


Mr. Ariful Hoque was impressed by the arrangements done for the contest along with the improved question pattern which was particularly done by keeping the last two contests in mind. Moreover, he expressed how many new labs and facilities can be developed and brought in so that the students can participate in many other competitions in the future.

title: Clemon Indoor Cricket Tournament 2023
description:
Clemon Indoor Cricket Tournament 2023

The cricket team of University of Scholars is participating in the Clemon Indoor Uni Cricket Tournament 2023 at the Shaheed Sohrawardi Indoor Stadium, Mirpur, Dhaka. On July 22, 2023, in the first match of group round, Scholars cricket team won by 19 runs against Independent University(IUB). In the second match on July 24, 2023, Scholars played against East West University(EWU) and won by 7 Runs. University of Scholars dominates the group stage with an unbeaten record winning by 13 runs against European University. 

Looking forward to achive the victory on Quarter Finals as well.

title: পিঠা উৎসব ১৪৩০
description:
পিঠা উৎসব ১৪৩০

Last Friday, January 26, 2024, the University of Scholars Campus hosted the Winter Pitha-Puli Festival. The festival is held from 2 pm to 7 pm. The festival was held at Campus House No-95, Block-B, Road No-04, Banani, Dhaka-1213.


In the said festival, students make different kinds of pithas and give stalls. Also, Ananya also makes pithas and gives stalls. There were a total of 9 stalls in the entire festival. Parents along with students also participated in the festival. The entire festival was filled with the joy of the guests.


The winter pitha-puli festival was attended by some dignitaries. They are: Admiral Muhammad Farid Habib (Retd), Chairman BOT, Mr. Md. Ariful Haque, Vice Chairman BOT, Mr. Abdul Hasib Siddique, Member BOT, Professor Dr. Enamul Bashar, VC (recruited), Prof. Dr. Md. Mamunur Rashid, VC (Acting), Capt. Mobashwer Ali Khandkar, PSC, BN (Retd.), Registrar.


At the festival, the guests appreciated the students by eating pitha-puli. They said that the students have made pitha-puli very beautifully. It is a unique aspect of our culture.


Through the said festival students can get familiar with their traditional culture. Also, they can express their creativity.

title: Honarable Adviser,Ministry of Environment,Forest and Climate Change and Ministry of Water Resources, Govenment of the people's Republic of Bangladesh
description:
Honarable Adviser,Ministry of Environment,Forest and Climate Change and Ministry of Water Resources, Govenment of the people's Republic of Bangladesh

ChatGPT said:

Syeda Rizwana Hasan is a distinguished Bangladeshi environmental lawyer and activist, renowned for her unwavering commitment to environmental justice and sustainable development. title: Campus Activation for Digital Bangladesh Mela
description:
Campus Activation for Digital Bangladesh Mela

The University of Scholars is pleased to host an attractive presentation held on 17th January 2023 at the university campus - the topic of discussion being “Safe Internet for Digital Bangladesh & Campus Activation for Digital Bangladesh Mela”


Renowned presenters successfully delivered lectures for the University of Scholars students and employees.

title: IUS Participates in AGREEN Foundation's Leadership development workshop
description:
IUS Participates in AGREEN Foundation's Leadership development workshop

The AGREEN Foundation recently organized a workshop on the 4th of August 2023 entitled "TOWARDS A DEVELOPED BANGLADESH – Thoughts and Preparation of the Youth" to foster leadership development among university students. The event saw enthusiastic participation from various institutions, including the Department of Business Administration at the International University of Scholars (IUS).

title: She Innovates: Empowering Young Women in Tech Showcase Your Innovation and Inspire the Future of Engineering
description:
She Innovates – a special event dedicated exclusively to female students to showcase your creativity, innovation, and engineering brilliance! Whether you’ve built a device, developed an app, designed a poster, or worked on a technical solution that solves real-world problems, this is your moment to shine.


Join a vibrant community of passionate young women ready to share ideas, inspire change, and break boundaries in science and technology. This event is not just about presenting projects—it's about empowerment, collaboration, and celebrating your unique voice in engineering.


🌟 Gain recognition, 🌍 connect with mentors, and 💡 spark inspiration in others with your innovation.


Let your ideas lead the way. She Innovates — because the future needs more women in tech!

title: 🤖 ROBO SOCCER ⚽ – Where Technology Meets the Thrill of the Game!
description:
🤖 ROBO SOCCER ⚽ – Where Technology Meets the Thrill of the Game!


Today’s session was a spectacular fusion of robotics and football, igniting the arena with incredible energy, teamwork, and innovation! From the buzz of assembling bots to the intensity of tactical gameplay, participants dove headfirst into a fast-paced world where engineering meets athletic strategy.


Students showcased their creativity by building agile, sensor-powered robots capable of dribbling, defending, and even scoring goals! The field came alive with cheering crowds, competitive spirit, and clever coding as each team battled it out in thrilling matches.


This unique event wasn’t just about competition—it was about problem-solving, collaboration, and pushing boundaries in the field of robotics. Participants gained hands-on experience in mechanics, electronics, and AI logic, all while having a blast.


👏 A huge shoutout to all teams for their brilliant designs and smart play. The future of tech-driven sports looks bright—and it started here, with ROBO SOCCER!

title: ⚽ Scholars Football Tournament 2025 – A Day to Remember! 🏆
description:
⚽ Scholars Football Tournament 2025 – A Day to Remember! 🏆


From the thrilling matches to the strategic player auctions, this year’s tournament brought passion, teamwork, and excitement to the field like never before! The event wasn’t just about competition—it was a showcase of talent, leadership, and sportsmanship at its finest.


Each team, led by its own team owner and dynamic lineup, battled with unmatched determination and heart. The crowd roared with every goal, tackle, and save, creating an atmosphere of pure adrenaline and school pride. The energy was electric from kick-off to the final whistle. 💥


Beyond the pitch, the event fostered a strong sense of community and camaraderie, with students, faculty, and supporters coming together to celebrate the beautiful game. Creative team names, custom jerseys, and roaring chants added even more color to the day!


👏 Congratulations to the champions, runners-up, and every player who gave it their all—your passion lit up the tournament and made history!


🎉 From dramatic penalties to last-minute goals, from underdog stories to unstoppable comebacks—every moment was a memory in the making.


📸 Here are some of the winning highlights, epic goals, team celebrations, and unforgettable snapshots that made this day truly special.


The Scholars Football Tournament 2025 wasn’t just an event—it was a legacy. Until next year, keep the spirit alive!

title: 1st Convocation of University of Scholars
description:
1st Convocation of University of Scholars

A Glorious Celebration of Excellence — Convocation 2025


The University of Scholars marked a historic milestone with the grand celebration of its Convocation Ceremony on February 22, 2025. The event was a magnificent tribute to academic excellence, honoring the dedication, perseverance, and triumph of more than 2,000 graduating students from diverse fields of study.


The ceremony unfolded with vibrant energy, bringing together esteemed faculty, proud families, distinguished guests, and the brilliant graduating class in a spirit of unity and celebration. Stirring speeches by university leaders and invited dignitaries inspired the audience, emphasizing the values of knowledge, service, and leadership in shaping a better world.


One of the highlights of the ceremony was the presentation of prestigious awards to students who demonstrated outstanding academic and personal accomplishments. We extend our heartfelt congratulations to the recipients of the Chancellor Gold Medals, whose exceptional achievements stood out as beacons of excellence, perseverance, and vision.


As graduates turned their tassels and stepped into a new chapter of life, the atmosphere was filled with pride, joy, and hope for the future. The University of Scholars applauds every graduate for their journey and achievements, and sends them forth with confidence to lead, innovate, and make meaningful contributions to society.


Here's to new beginnings, bold ambitions, and a lifelong commitment to making a difference in the world!

title: ThinkSpire 12: A Journey of Inspiration and Leadership
description:
ThinkSpire 12: A Journey of Inspiration and Leadership

The University of Scholars was honored to host a powerful and transformative mentorship session and workshop titled "ThinkSpire 12", led by our respected Vice Chairman and Board of Trustee member, Mr. Md. Ariful Hoque Shuhan (Shuhan Mohammad Ariful Hoque). The event served as a platform for students to gain valuable insights, motivation, and direction as they shape their futures in an ever-evolving world.

The session began with an inspiring keynote address from Mr. Shuhan, who shared his personal experiences, leadership philosophy, and guidance for young minds. His speech was filled with encouragement for students to think critically, act responsibly, and lead with integrity. With a calm and thoughtful presence, Mr. Shuhan emphasized the importance of mindset, resilience, and purpose-driven learning. He encouraged students to embrace challenges, remain focused on long-term goals, and believe in their ability to create change.

One of the key messages of the session was that leadership is not just about authority—it is about service, vision, and values. Mr. Shuhan spoke about how real leaders are those who inspire others, remain humble, and constantly strive for improvement. He urged students to never stop learning and to cultivate habits that promote both academic excellence and personal growth.

Following the mentorship talk, the session moved into an interactive workshop where students participated in group discussions and activities that simulated real-life problem-solving and leadership situations. These tasks were designed to foster teamwork, creativity, communication, and strategic thinking. Students had the chance to voice their ideas, receive feedback, and apply what they learned in practical ways.

Many participants expressed that the workshop gave them new perspectives on how to lead, collaborate, and face real-world problems. The experience helped them feel more confident and equipped to handle future responsibilities. For many, it was not just an event but a life-changing moment that ignited their passion to pursue their dreams more boldly.

What made ThinkSpire 12 particularly special was the authentic connection built between Mr. Shuhan and the students. His approachability, sincerity, and dedication to youth development left a lasting impression on everyone in the room. His words reminded students that success comes not only from talent but from hard work, discipline, and the right mindset.

The event concluded with gratitude and applause, as students and faculty acknowledged Mr. Shuhan’s impactful contribution. His presence and mentorship reflected the university’s ongoing mission to cultivate future leaders who are not only skilled but also compassionate and visionary.

ThinkSpire 12 was more than a workshop—it was a meaningful step toward building a generation that is prepared to lead with heart, intelligence, and responsibility. The University of Scholars remains committed to hosting such initiatives that empower students to thrive, inspire change, and make a positive difference in the world.


  • Date :Nov 30, 2024
  • Times :15:30
  • Location :40, Kemal Ataturk Ave, Bulu Ocean Tower, University of Scholars, Banani, Dhaka 1213

title: Case Conquest 1.0: Celebrating Strategic Brilliance and Innovation A Thrilling Showcase of Business Acumen and Competitive Excellence
description:
What an incredible journey it was! From thought-provoking business strategies to competitive brilliance — Case Conquest 1.0 was a massive success!


👏 Congratulations to the Champion, 1st Runner-Up, and 2nd Runner-Up teams for standing out among the best minds. Your innovative thinking truly stole the spotlight!


Presented by: Keeron

Powered by: Englishology

Media Partners: The Daily Star & Channel 24


Stay tuned for more exciting opportunities to challenge your limits and lead the future of business! 🚀

Case Conquest 1.0: A Celebration of Strategy, Innovation, and Competitive Spirit

Case Conquest 1.0 marked a dynamic milestone in the academic and business community, bringing together some of the brightest minds to compete in a test of strategy, critical thinking, and innovation. Organized with great enthusiasm and professionalism, the event was presented by Keeron, powered by Englishology, and supported by The Daily Star and Channel 24 as media partners. It was more than just a competition—it was a platform to inspire, challenge, and celebrate the next generation of business leaders.

The event attracted passionate university students and aspiring professionals from across the country, all eager to demonstrate their skills in solving real-world business problems. Through a series of intense and thought-provoking case-solving rounds, participants were pushed to their intellectual limits, encouraged to think on their feet, and present innovative yet practical solutions.

Each round brought forward a unique business challenge, allowing teams to dive deep into analytics, strategy, and presentation. From marketing dilemmas to operational hurdles, every case required teamwork, sharp judgment, and a strong grasp of business fundamentals. The level of competition was incredibly high, showcasing just how capable and prepared today’s young minds are for tackling tomorrow’s business challenges.

One of the most inspiring aspects of Case Conquest 1.0 was witnessing how teams approached problems from different angles, combining creativity with data-driven strategies. Judges and mentors praised the participants for their professionalism, depth of analysis, and clarity in presenting ideas. The event was a true testament to the power of youth, innovation, and education coming together.

After a fierce competition, the moment everyone had been waiting for finally arrived. With immense excitement and pride, the Champion, 1st Runner-Up, and 2nd Runner-Up teams were announced. These teams stood out not only for the brilliance of their solutions but also for the confidence, collaboration, and determination they exhibited throughout the competition. Congratulations poured in from all sides, and their victories were celebrated as a symbol of excellence and dedication.

But Case Conquest 1.0 wasn’t just about winning—it was about learning, growing, and networking. Participants had the chance to connect with industry professionals, receive valuable feedback, and build relationships that could shape their future careers. The event also highlighted the importance of soft skills like communication, leadership, and time management, which are crucial in today’s fast-paced corporate world.

In conclusion, Case Conquest 1.0 was a massive success—an event that left a mark on everyone who participated or attended. It set a new standard for student-led business competitions and opened doors for future opportunities. With such a strong start, the organizing team has already sparked excitement for the next edition. For now, the legacy of Case Conquest 1.0 stands as a celebration of intellect, innovation, and the boundless potential of youth.

title: Textile Engineering Shines at National Talent Hunt Students Achieve Top Honors in Season 9.0 Competition
description:
We are proud to announce the remarkable achievement of our Textile Engineering students at the Textile Talent Hunt Competition Season 9.0! For the first time, 14 students from our university participated in this prestigious national event, held at ICCB, where students from 40 universities across Bangladesh competed.

Our students showcased incredible talent, creativity, and technical knowledge, making a strong impression on the judges and industry leaders present. Among the participants, 6 of our students secured positions in the Top 20, a significant accomplishment that reflects the quality of education and dedication within our department.

Adding to the pride, one of our outstanding students from the 15th batch achieved the honor of 2nd Runner-up, a truly prestigious recognition at such a competitive platform. The event was attended by renowned professionals, industrialists, and academics, providing our students with the opportunity to gain valuable insights and connect with the broader textile industry.

This success is a milestone for our Textile Engineering department and a testament to the hard work of both students and faculty. It serves as an inspiration for future participants and reaffirms our commitment to excellence in education, innovation, and industry collaboration.


Textile Engineering Shines at National Talent Hunt
Students Achieve Top Honors in Season 9.0 Competition

We are proud to announce the remarkable achievement of our Textile Engineering students at the Textile Talent Hunt Competition Season 9.0! title: Seminar on Unlocking Career & Academic Opportunities Through English Proficiency Home Seminar on Unlocking Career & Academic Opportunities Through English Proficiency
description:
Seminar on Unlocking Career & Academic Opportunities Through English Proficiency

The University of Scholars successfully hosted a seminar titled "Unlocking Career & Academic Opportunities Through English Proficiency", aimed at helping students understand the importance of English in both academic and professional fields. The session featured experienced speakers who shared how strong English skills can lead to better university performance, success in international exams, scholarship opportunities, and global career prospects.

Students learned practical tips on improving their reading, writing, speaking, and listening abilities. The seminar also emphasized how English fluency boosts confidence, improves public speaking, and helps in job interviews and workplace communication. Interactive activities and open discussions made the session engaging and informative.

The event encouraged students to treat English not as a subject, but as a life skill that opens doors to leadership, international exposure, and personal growth. It ended with a reminder that language learning is a journey—and progress, not perfection, is the goal.

The University of Scholars continues to support students in enhancing their English proficiency through regular workshops and interactive programs.


  • Date :Feb 19, 2025
  • Times :15:30
  • Location :40 Kemal Ataturk Avenue, Bulu Ocean Tower, University of Scholars Campus.

title: Convocation Speech Explanation – University of Scholars
description:
Convocation Speech Explanation – University of Scholars

Convocation is one of the most significant and emotional milestones in a student's academic journey. It marks the formal completion of a chapter filled with learning, growth, and hard work. At the University of Scholars, convocation is not just a ceremony—it’s a celebration of achievement, transformation, and the beginning of new opportunities.

During the convocation, graduating students are honored for their dedication and success. It is a moment when their years of effort, challenges, and accomplishments are recognized in the presence of respected faculty members, parents, mentors, and distinguished guests. Academic gowns and caps symbolize the tradition and pride associated with this important event.

The convocation ceremony typically begins with the academic procession, followed by speeches from university leaders, including the Chancellor, Vice-Chancellor, and special guests. These speeches highlight the values of the university, the importance of lifelong learning, and the responsibilities graduates have as future leaders in society.

Degrees are formally conferred during the event, and many graduates receive special recognition for academic excellence or outstanding contributions. The atmosphere is filled with pride, hope, and emotion as students look back on their journey and ahead to their future.

Convocation is not the end—it is the beginning of new dreams, challenges, and accomplishments.

title: CES 6th Intra University Programming Contest
description:
CES 6th Intra University Programming Contest

The University of Scholars proudly presents the 6th Intra University Programming Contest, a flagship event hosted by the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) in collaboration with The University of Scholars Problem-Solving Community, and powered by our valued event partner, Envyweb Studio.


This highly anticipated contest brings together the university’s brightest and most passionate coders for a day of intense logic, algorithmic thinking, and competitive problem-solving. Students will go head-to-head in solving real-world challenges that test their creativity, speed, and programming expertise.


The competition is more than just a contest—it’s a celebration of innovation, critical thinking, and collaboration among the future leaders of the tech world. Whether you're a seasoned coder or an aspiring problem solver, this event is designed to push your limits and ignite your passion for coding.


🏆 Exciting prizes, 📜 certificates of achievement, and the thrill of rising through the ranks await all participants.


Join us as we witness the power of code shaping ideas into solutions.

Let the countdown to code begin!


Let me know if you'd like a version formatted for email invites, posters, or social media graphics!

title: We’re thrilled to announce that ‘RoboMore Dynamic Sparks’, representing the University of Scholars, has emerged as the CHAMPION in the Line Follower Robot category at UIU CSE FEST 2025! 🚀
description:
Victory for Innovation!


We’re thrilled to announce that ‘RoboMore Dynamic Sparks’, representing the University of Scholars, has emerged as the CHAMPION in the Line Follower Robot category at UIU CSE FEST 2025! 🚀


With precision, creativity, and outstanding teamwork, the team outperformed competitors from across the nation, showcasing their engineering brilliance and robotic excellence. Their robot not only followed the line — it led the way to victory!


A huge congratulations to the winning team on securing the 1st place trophy and a cash prize of 25,000 BDT. Your innovation and dedication continue to inspire the entire university community.


Here’s to many more milestones, breakthroughs, and triumphs ahead!


RoboMore Dynamic Sparks’, representing the University of Scholars, has emerged as the CHAMPION in the Line Follower Robot category at UIU CSE FEST 2025!

title: University of Scholars Hosts Historic 1st Convocation Graduates Honored with Certificates and Medals for Academic Excellence
description:
At the University of Scholars, the 1st Convocation was a proud and historic moment, celebrating the achievements of its very first graduating batch. During this grand ceremony, students were formally awarded their degree certificates as a symbol of their successful completion of academic programs.

To honor academic excellence, select students who achieved top positions in their departments were also awarded medals, recognizing their outstanding performance and dedication throughout their studies. These medals represent more than just academic success—they are a symbol of hard work, perseverance, and commitment to excellence.

The convocation was attended by university leaders, respected guests, faculty members, and proud families, all gathered to witness this milestone. With academic gowns, joyful smiles, and the spirit of achievement in the air, the event marked the beginning of a new journey for every graduate. It was a celebration of knowledge, growth, and the bright future that lies ahead.

title: Virtual Project Show 2025: Showcasing Innovation and Technical Excellence A Prestigious Platform for Future Tech Leaders at the University of Scholars
description:
Virtual Project Show 2025 – University of Scholars

The Virtual Project Show 2025 is a prestigious academic and technical event hosted by the University of Scholars, aimed at showcasing innovative and impactful projects developed by students across various disciplines.


This competition provides a platform for young minds to present their creativity, technical skills, and problem-solving abilities through web-based applications, software solutions, and IT-based innovations. Students have the opportunity to demonstrate their work in front of an esteemed panel of judges consisting of faculty members, researchers, and professionals from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE).


🔍 Objectives:

To encourage innovation and research-oriented project development among students.


To enhance presentation and communication skills through virtual demonstrations.


To provide real-world feedback from experienced judges.


To foster collaboration and competition among participants from diverse backgrounds.


🏆 Event Highlights:

Event Date: Tuesday, 08 April 2025


Time: 10:00 PM


Result Announcement: On the official Facebook page – facebook.com/UniversityofScholars


Judging Criteria: Innovation, Technical Implementation, Presentation, Practical Impact


This virtual showcase is not only a celebration of talent but also a stepping stone for students to gain recognition, improve their portfolios, and prepare for professional challenges ahead.

title: FutureMinds: Student Research & Innovation Fair
description:
FutureMinds: Student Research & Innovation Fair

FutureMinds is an exciting and forward-thinking academic event designed to spotlight the brightest ideas, projects, and research developed by university students. Hosted by the university, this fair brings together emerging innovators, researchers, and tech enthusiasts for a day of knowledge sharing, collaboration, and creative exploration.


From cutting-edge software applications and engineering models to impactful social solutions and scientific research, FutureMinds showcases a wide range of student-led initiatives aimed at solving real-world problems. The fair provides a vibrant platform for students to present their work before an audience of academic experts, industry professionals, and peers.


🎯 Key Objectives:

Celebrate student-driven innovation and discovery


Provide real-world exposure through presentations and exhibits


Encourage interdisciplinary collaboration and teamwork


Connect students with mentors, judges, and potential investors


📌 Event Highlights:

Live project demonstrations


Poster presentations & research talks


Expert panel of judges and awards


Networking with faculty and industry leaders


FutureMinds is more than a showcase—it's a launchpad for the next generation of thinkers, builders, and change-makers.

title: A Historic Milestone for the University of Scholars Celebrating Academic Excellence with Syeda Rizwana Hasan as Convocation President
description:
The University of Scholars proudly celebrated its 1st Convocation Ceremony with great honor and enthusiasm. The momentous occasion was graced by the presence of Syeda Rizwana Hasan, Honorable Adviser to the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the Ministry of Water Resources, Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, serving as the Convocation President.


This historic event marked a significant milestone for the university, celebrating the academic achievements of its graduating students, and inspiring them to lead with integrity, knowledge, and a commitment to national development. Distinguished guests, faculty members, and proud graduates gathered to reflect on years of hard work, growth, and scholarly excellence.


The convocation was not just a ceremonial event, but a heartfelt tribute to the pursuit of education, innovation, and service to society.1st Convocation Ceremony – University of Scholars

The momentous occasion was graced by the presence of Syeda Rizwana Hasan, Honorable Adviser to the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the Ministry of Water Resources, Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, serving as the Convocation President.
This historic event marked a significant milestone for the university, celebrating the academic achievements of its graduating students, and inspiring them to lead with integrity, knowledge, and a commitment to national development. Distinguished guests, faculty members, and proud graduates gathered to reflect on years of hard work, growth, and scholarly excellence.
The convocation was not just a ceremonial event, but a heartfelt tribute to the pursuit of education, innovation, and service to society.

title: Convocation 2025: A Moment of Triumph and New Beginnings Graduates Celebrate Success and Step Boldly Into the Future
description:
Convocation 2025 – University of Scholars


It’s Time for Celebration – Convocation 2025


A proud moment captured in time—graduates of the University of Scholars stand tall in their caps and gowns, holding their hard-earned certificates and wearing the smiles of success. This group photograph, taken during the university’s 1st Convocation Ceremony, reflects years of dedication, learning, and personal growth.


Under the powerful theme "It’s Time for Celebration," this day honored not just academic achievement, but the courage, persistence, and dreams of every graduate. Together, they step into a new chapter of life—empowered, confident, and ready to make a difference.


More than a photo, it is a memory of triumph, unity, and new beginnings.
